intro: Randia hapalophylla, commonly known as the small-leaved randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Randia hapalophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
